business.headline: Trump allies plan to privatise Fannie and Freddie, says reportThe discussions involve prominent figures close to Trump, including Larry Kudlow, the former director of the National Economic Council, and John McEntee, who previously worked in the White House.

Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv shares gain amid housing unit IPO buzzThe buzz around the Bajaj Housing Finance IPO, which is set to make its stock market debut on September 16, has led traders on Dalal Street to snap up shares of other publicly traded Bajaj companies, hoping to capitalise on the momentum.

Western Carriers IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe or skip? Western Carriers (India) Limited has allocated 85,96,743 equity shares to 15 anchor investors, raising Rs 148 crore before its proposed IPO.

Adani Group rejects Hindenburg claim of Swiss banks' $310 million funds freezeHindenburg cited a Swiss media outlet, Gotham City, which alleged that more than $310 million belonging to an alleged frontman for billionaire Gautam Adani is sequestered in six Swiss banks. The Adani Group "unequivocally" rejected the claim.

Amazon, Flipkart found violating Indian competition laws: ReportA probe by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart engaged in anti-competitive practices by favouring select sellers on their platforms.

Understanding circle rates: A simple guide for homebuyers and sellersUnderstanding the concept of circle rates, and how they influence property valuations, has become critical for anyone navigating the real estate market.
Retail inflation rises to 3.65% in August, second lowest in last five yearsRetail inflation rises to 3.65 per cent in August compared to 3.6 per cent in July, as per government data.

India's semiconductor boom: These stocks could be your best pickThe development of the semiconductor value chain—ranging from chip design to manufacturing and assembly, is expected to benefit various companies in the sector.

Sensex gains 1,500 points on US rate cut optimism; Granules India tanks 17%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,439.55 points to 82,962.71 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained nearly 470.45 points to settle at 25,388.90.

Explained: Why Granules India shares crashed nearly 17% todayGranules India stock price: With this drop, the stock now trades roughly 22% below its all-time high of Rs 724.55, reached earlier in the month

PwC to cut 1,800 jobs in US; First major layoff since 2009The layoff affects approximately 2.5% of the company's US workforce and impacts a range of positions, including associates, managing directors, and employees in business services, audit, and tax departments.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Life is not khata-khat: S Jaishankar's veiled dig at Rahul Gandhi in GenevaJaishankar made the remark while he was speaking on the infrastructural development undertaken by the Narendra Modi-led government at an event in Geneva.

Sam Pitroda says not aware of assault on India Today reporter by Congress team in DallasAfter an India Today journalist alleged that he was manhandled by Rahul Gandhi's team, Sam Pitroda said he doesn't appreciate this kind of treatment for anybody and would look into the matter.

2 soldiers dead in J&K encounter, 3 terrorists killed in another operationFour Army personnel were injured in an encounter in Kishtwar. Two of them, including a Junior Commissioned Officer, succumbed to injuries.

Vinesh Phogat didn't want to challenge CAS' verdict: Lawyer Harish SalveSenior lawyer Harish Salve debunked wrestler Vinesh Phogat's allegations regarding leniency by the Indian Olympic Association lawyers while fighting her case in the Court of Arbitration for Sport during the Paris Olympics 2024.

How smart packaging is bringing in big money for food businessesWith the online delivery market booming, food delivery is no longer just about satisfying hunger. Brands are stepping up to offer customers a complete home dining experience.

One against migrants, other kills children: Pope Francis on Trump, Kamala HarrisFormer US President Donald Trump has promised to introduce strong anti-immigration policies if elected to power, while Kamala Harris has supported abortion rights.

Bank employees die after SUV gets stuck in submerged Faridabad underpassA police official stated that the victims were warned about the underpass being submerged due to heavy rain in Delhi-NCR. However, the two insisted on driving through it.

Karnataka BJP MLA's 'Muslim or Christian' jab at Rahul Gandhi stirs rowThe BJP MLA from Karnataka's Bijapur City Assembly Constituency called for an investigation to be done to ascertain the Congress leader's true lineage.

Women's safety in entertainment: TV stars and their call for change in industryRecent discussions on women's safety in the entertainment industry have been intensified by the #MeToo movement and the Hema Committee Report, both highlighting the need for reforms to protect women from harassment and abuse. For this Cinematic Saturday, several stars have shed light on how this issue extends beyond films to television, as they advocate for safer working conditions on shooting sets.
Be quiet: Joe Biden rebukes reporter asking about Putin's war threat to USThe incident happened as Joe Biden and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer held a key meeting at the White House in Washington.

X account hacked: Noida official clarifies 'Pappu' jibe at Rahul Gandhi in postGautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Manish Verma said that his social media account was hacked, leading to derogatory posts targeting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.

How Pacific Cyclone Yagi might bring another wet spell in Delhi next weekThe remnants of Cyclone Yagi, originating in the Pacific, are expected to intensify into a depression within 48 hours, prompting alerts for East India, particularly Bengal, Jharkhand, and Odisha. Meanwhile, Delhi is set for drier weather with a potential wet spell.
GST slashed on 3 cancer drugs: How will it benefit patients?The union government has reduced GST on three cancer drugs from 12% to 5%, following an earlier exemption from basic customs duty.

Morne Morkel reveals phone call with dad after landing India jobMorne Morkel recalled the emotional moment when he called his father after being appointed as India's bowling coach. Reuniting with Gautam Gambhir, Morkel now prepares for his role in the upcoming Test series against Bangladesh.

Abhishek Singhvi decodes Arvind Kejriwal's bail conditions: He can sign files...Senior lawyer Abhishek Manu Singhvi cleared up the confusion over Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's ability to sign official files, emphasising that the Supreme Court's recent order has not altered prior conditions.

PM's rally in J&K's Doda today, 1st visit by Indian Prime Minister in 42 yearsPrime Minister Narendra Modi will hold campaign rallies in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda and Haryana's Kurukshetra today. His visit to Doda will mark the first visit to the region by an Indian Prime Minister in 42 years.

TV host Robert Alleva interacts with 'world's oldest crocodile' in viral videoIn a viral video, TV personality Robert Alleva interacts with a massive Nile crocodile believed to be the world's oldest living crocodile.

Realised father on hijacked plane, while handling 1984 crisis, says Jaishankar External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar recalled the time when he was handling a hijacking crisis and discovered that his father was on that hijacked flight. Jaishankar opened up about the 1984 Indian Airlines plane hijacking as the Netflix series, IC 814 - The Kandahar Hijack, brought back memories of the 1999 hostage-taking incident.

Anwar Ali's suspension withdrawn, national football body to reconsider issueThe Delhi High Court was told by the national football governing body that the fourth-month ban it slapped on Anwar Ali would be withdrawn. AIFF said the issue will be reconsidered. The court was hearing petitions by Ali and his current side East Bengal, and the parent club Delhi FC against the decision of the Players Status Committee.

Easwaran, Jagadeesan build for India B after India C's huge totalDuleep Trophy: Abhimanyu Easwaran and Narayan Jagadeesan built an unbeaten partnership of 124 runs with India B still trailing India C by 401 runs at Stumps on Day 2 in Anantapur.

Rohit Sharma is like Aamir Khan from Lagaan movie: Sarfaraz Khan India vs Bangladesh: Speaking ahead of India's upcoming Test season, Sarfaraz Khan highlighted Rohit Sharma's calming influence on the team, saying the skipper is like a 'big brother' to youngsters in the team. Sarfaraz likened Rohit to Aamir Khan's character from the Bollywood film Lagaan.

Unjust removing Shaheen Shah Afridi as T20I captain: Moin Khan Moin Khan said that Pakistan should have persisted with Shaheen Shah Afridi as the skipper of the Pakistan T20I team. Earlier this year, Babar Azam replaced Shaheen as the captain in the shorter format.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
